parameters.name: BX_SC
parameters.description: The X-component of the magnetic field in the PVO Inertial Spacecraft Coordinate System (PVO_ISCC). This is the component that lies in the sunward direction in the plane that contains the Sun-spacecraft vector and the spacecraft spin axis.

parameters.name: BY_SC
parameters.description: The Y-component of the magnetic field in the PVO Inertial Spacecraft Coordinate System (PVO_ISCC). The Y axis is formed by the right-handed vector cross product of the X and Z unit vectors where the Z axis is anti-parallel to the spacecraft spin axis and the X-Z plane contains the Sun.

parameters.name: BZ_SC
parameters.description: The Z-component of the magnetic field in the PVO Inertial Spacecraft Coordinate System (PVO_ISCC). The Z axis is defined to be anti-parallel to the spacecraft spin axis during orbital operations.

parameters.name: BT
parameters.description: The vector magnitude of the sampled field components.

parameters.name: BX_SC
parameters.description: The X-component of the magnetic field in the Venus Solar Orbital System (VSO - GSE at Venus). The system is Venus centered, with the X axis pointing instantaneously from Venus to the Sun, the Z axis is perpendicular to the orbital (ecliptic) plane of Venus positive 'up', and the Y axis completing the right-handed set.

parameters.name: BY_VSO
parameters.description: The Y-component of the magnetic field in Venus Solar Orbital coordinates. This component is the right-handed vector cross product of the Z and X unit vectors, and lies in the Venus orbital plane, positive towards dusk.

parameters.name: BZ_VSO
parameters.description: The Z-component of the magnetic field in Venus Solar Orbital coordinates. This component is parallel to the northwards pole of the Venus orbital plane.
